attributes.action: Introduce points based system for citizens of non-neighbouring countries.
attributes.background: Introduce points based system for all prospective immigrants who are not citizens of our immediate neighbouring countries (Ireland, France, Iceland, Belgium, Netherlands, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Germany and Sweden. (List of countries to be debated.))

attributes.action: Ensure sovereignty cannot be transferred from parliament without a referendum.
attributes.background: When we leave the EU the power to make and enforce laws will be returned to the UK parliament and courts.  We need legislation to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The power of the UK parliament and courts to make and enforce legislation has been gradually eroded over 40 years of EU membership.  Now that we are at last getting these powers back we need legislation affirming that sovereignty, that is to say the power to make and enforce our own laws, belongs to the people and to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without the consent of the people through a referendum.

attributes.action: Hold another EU referendum for voters aged 16 to 35
attributes.background: As we are the future let us have a say in our future

attributes.action: Make it law that only one referendum can be held on an issue in a 5 year period
attributes.background: Following the result of the EU referendum which took months of campaigning and cost millions of taxpayer's pounds, some people who voted remain are attempting to have a 2nd referendum called because they weren't happy with the majority vote. A referendum should be a one time vote on an issue.
attributes.additional_details: A 2nd EU referendum would cost millions of pounds more of tax payers money and be inflicted on a public who generally don't have the appetite for a 2nd referendum. This would be the case in future referendums on other issues too as a precedent would be set now if a 2nd referendum was called.

attributes.action: In a 2nd EU referendum, only those whom did not vote initially may take part.
attributes.background: It is the only way which is fair.

attributes.action: Negotiate with EU to allow UK/EU passports to give full EU passage until expired
attributes.background: UK passport holders need the right of passage within existing EU territories using our UK/EU passport in the same way as we use Pre Referendum

attributes.action: Block retrospective changes to the European Referendum Act 2015
attributes.background: The referendum to leave the European Union was carried out fairly and in line with the following act; European Union Referendum Act 2015. We the undersigned petition that this act is not ammended retrospectively and no provisions made for a minimum turnout to be achieved for results to be binding.

attributes.action: UK to hold a new EU referendum if Scotland leave the UK before Brexit.
attributes.background: If Scotland vote leave the UK before the EU exit the UK public should have a new EU referendum where they can consider these significantly changed circumstances.

attributes.action: Vote against any act of Parliament related to EU exit in the next 3 months
attributes.background: A referendum is for guidance to our elected representatives - it does not absolve MPs from using their judgement. The will of the people is divided and not settled: the UK majority was only 3.8% and the future of the Union is in jeopardy. As the implications become clearer Public opinion may shift.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Remove political parties from UK Government Procedures
attributes.background: The people of the UK call upon the current UK Government to offer to form a cross-party coalition Government, and then to change the law to require all MPs to resign from their respective political parties. The Government should then set up regional groups of independent MPs to replace the parties.
attributes.additional_details: With no political parties, UK decisions would be made on the basis of geographical consensus, with MPs working in perhaps 12 Regional Groups at Westminster and taking their individual policy mandate from their own local councillors within their individual Constituency.

attributes.action: Lower the legal drinking age to 17
attributes.background: Lowering the legal drinking age could reduce & tackle the problem of binge drinking in the UK - as well as help young people socially as young school leavers can find it difficult to find friends of a similar age in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: There are multiple reasons for this action to be taken. One reason being that lowering the legal drinking age could prevent people binge drinking when they finally reach 18 years, for example, like a child who's only been allowed fruit & vegetables being let loose at a party full of sweets. In other countries such as France, Germany & Belgium, the legal drinking age is 16 - although a restriction is kept on spirits until 18. I feel that the UK should be keeping up with other countries.

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: NHS Charges for non National insurance payers
attributes.background: This issue is important because the NHS needs help and people that do not pay into the national insurance program should be asked to pay for their treatment received, We as tax payers all have NI Numbers
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is that when we are first seen in A&E we are asked for our NI card as proof that we are entitled to free treatment, If we cannot provide this then we are asked how we are going to pay either Credit card or insurance documents. Just like checking into a hotel the card is swiped at first contact. On completion of treatment the card on insurance company are charged at the going rate of charges, This will help prevent the strain on NHS resources, and bring us in line with other countries

attributes.action: Call for a second EU referendum due to misleading campaign lies in the first.
attributes.background: Lies made informed choices less likely. Unlike exaggeration & forecasts (where some variability may be inherent) lies have no factual basis. Among many, 2 prominent were: £350 million/wk paid to EU – to go to the NHS; & Turkey on the cusp of EU admission. Genuine & thorough campaign info was scarce.
attributes.additional_details: An independent body should regulate campaign information (as in commerce, where lies are justifiably banned). Democracy can't exist if voters can't judge the options, & as campaigns may be biased their protest to lies is inadequate. Additional reasons for a 2nd, honest referendum are: no mandate for Brexit's form; nearly half-in-half results; possible UK break-up; many years of negotiation likely; renegotiation of all current world trade deals; less EU trade access; & EU rules we have no say in.

attributes.action: UK Government should provide incentives to foreign startups and small companies.
attributes.background: All foreign companies  contributes  a lot  UK economy, employment by paying taxes and creating jobs.  Government  has to amend Foreign Direct Investment policy to increase investments .This can be interest free loans or  discount in VAT or Taxes.Recognise them as 'MAKE IN UK' companies.
attributes.additional_details: Due to Brexit effect all foreign companies  are in big ambiguity whether to stay in UK or NOT.Especially startup companies,budding  entrepreneurs and small scale companies are mostly effected.Fear of upcoming changes in trading law  may discourage  their plans and ventures in UK. It’s going to effect largely to the future UK economy and the growth. UK Government should encourage them.

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: Prevent terrorist lorry attacks using temporary concrete stanchions.
attributes.background: Temporary concrete stanchions at public events and locations prevent terrorist lorry attacks. All UK locations where significant numbers of people are gathered in small spaces must be temporarily or permanently protected by suitable lorry stopping devices.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36806691 This is established technology - after the attack in Berlin these devices were deployed, they should have been deployed beforehand. To not do so is pure ignorance. The argument that they are an eyesore is invalid, you can dress them up like Santa or Snowmen. Whatever is in keeping with the event.

attributes.action: Introduce "tax free allowance" after working 37.5 hours or more per week
attributes.background: Every year, thousands of hard working people work 50/60 hour weeks to supplement their pay and are taxed to high heaven. If someone works hard, should they have their reward taken from them? People should not be taxed for working extra.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: Reading Prison as an Enterprise Zone for new Businesses.
attributes.background: This petition proposes the multiuse development of Reading Prison. The Grade II-listed building would be used as a ‘Business Incubator’ where start-up companies share communal infrastructure but operate within a designated space themselves. The remaining site would be a residential development.
attributes.additional_details:
This site is perfect for new businesses, with access to the station as well as supporting industries in the surrounding area.
Existing centres of innovation (The University and Business parks) could be sources of collaboration.
Ernst and Young forecasts Reading to be the fastest growing local economy in the UK, making this a pivotal moment in Reading's economic future.
The prison site will enable a diverse range of new businesses to develop, further spreading Reading’s prosperity.

attributes.action: charge UKentrants £10 a week insurance to cover possible use of our NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a lot of money is lost from free treatment and chasing for payment for treatment with a set duty of £10 a week Im sure the NHS would be a lot better off

attributes.action: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1%
attributes.background: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1% to be used exclusively for the NHS & Social Care. With the NHS and Social Care in turmoil both facing unprecedented funding shortages, it is time for the UK workforce to help further fund these services.
attributes.additional_details: Polling has shown that 48% would support a 1% increase in national insurance contributions to go towards the NHS and Social Care.

attributes.action: Save cyclists' lives by introducing 'The Dutch Reach' into the Driving Test
attributes.background: To simply and cheaply save cyclists' lives, we need to require a person to use their opposite hand to open a car door if they are to pass a driving test. This turns the body bringing passing cyclists into view.
attributes.additional_details:
This tiny change is called 'The Dutch Reach' as it is used in the Netherlands.  It saves people on bikes from being knocked into traffic when people open car doors. Using the opposite hand to open a car door forces the body to turn, so the driver sees the cyclist and fewer people are injured and killed on the roads. Such as this incident:

http://gu.com/p/5g79g?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other 

Video: see http://www.pri.org/stories/2016-09-27/easy-maneuver-borrowed-dutch-could-be-life-saving-cyclists

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!

attributes.action: invest HS2 funding into social care.
attributes.background: Social care in England is grossly underfunded, to the point of collapse, HS2 is a vanity development which should be shelved until austerity measures have passed or be completely privately funded.

attributes.action: Criminal Justice System to accept polygraph results as evidence.
attributes.background: For serious offences a Polygraph test should be used as evidence. For crimes such as historic child abuse where independent witnesses will not really exist. As nearly all children who are abused will by themselves. These results should be used or funding for research should be given.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the results to be used or funding granted to make these tests more accurate. 
 
Some people believe that the lie detectors are 90% accurate when other believe they are around 70% accurate. http://abcnews.go.com/US/story?id=92847

When eyewitness statements are used as evidence and their accuracy can be within this %.

What we want is some form of lie detector to be used in the near future as evidence.

attributes.action: Introduce CPR and Basic First Aid to the driving test
attributes.background: CPR as well as basic first aid should be a requirement to pass a uk driving test as driving can be a dangerous thing and you never know when you may need to use those skills, which in turn could potentially save someones life

attributes.action: Support a Unilateral Declaration of Independence for the Kurdistan Region
attributes.background:
In order to maintain peace and stability, it is in the vital interest of the west and neighbours to allow the formal process. 

The KRG leadership has declared the need for an imminent referendum; and the region  has proved to be a partner in trade, the fight against terrorism, and peace for all.

attributes.action: The Jury Should be Scrapped.
attributes.background: I feel that the jury should be scrapped due to the impact that the decision will have on the persons life. If the ECJ doesn't use a jury, why should other courts.

attributes.action: Protect pension funds by changing the law governing distributions by companies
attributes.background:
Companies Act 2006 fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous for personal gain

Signing this petition may be your best chance to secure the financial future of your company’s pension fund and your life in retirement.
attributes.additional_details:
Accumulative distributable reserves brought forward should be used to cover the pension fund deficit first before further distributions. 

Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.

Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and remain with the company.

Read more at the-empty-chair(dot)com

attributes.action: reverse the the decision not to allow cashing in of annuities
attributes.background: many people had made financial arrangements based on the promise that annuities could be cashed in

attributes.action: Introduce plain bottles for alcoholic drinks to discourage drinking.
attributes.background: The government decision to introduce plain packaging for cigarettes while leaving alcoholic brands to market their poison in fancy bottles is hypocrisy. Correct this mistake by forcing them too to get rid of their marketing. If the government is interested in saving people's health, this is obvious.
attributes.additional_details: One does not need to Google for long to find that alcohol is the nation's biggest killer, that it - especially in this season - severely strains out emergency response teams and is highly addictive. Not advocating prohibition of any substance, but it is simply not right to villify one drug while leaving another untouched. I cannot imagine how anyone can justify such a move with a clear consciousness.

attributes.action: Change the law so neighbours can't play loud music at anytime not just after 11
attributes.background: In todays world people don't just work 9 till 5 and require sleep at various hrs of the day. Police have no powers to intervene before 11pm or after 7am. People have been forced to move and made ill from being forced to put up with music played unacceptably loud within flats.

attributes.action: Please, Contract BAE to develop a Harrier III.
attributes.background: The Harrier was the ONLY V/STOL jet IN THE WORLD. Instead of capitalising on a technological monopoly, the British Government sold the country out and our industry out to the Americans. Now we buy their exorbitant £100+ Million a piece F-35 STOVL jet with a program cost of $1.5 Trillion. Shameful.
attributes.additional_details: The cost to develop a Harrier III from the Harrier II, I am absolutely certain, would have been a fraction of the disastrous, bug ridden JSF program. The Unit cost too, I am certain, would have been been fractional. It's a matter of national pride too. What do we have left that we can be proud of? Concorde? Harrier? The world wanted these things. But no. Scrap it and buy American or EU... 'REDUCE F-35 ORDER AND REINVEST THE REMAINING *Billions* INTO A SYMBOL OF NATIONAL PRIDE: The Harrier III'.

attributes.action: parliament make a law. No levy on diesel cars before park & ride system in place
attributes.background:
As an asthmatic i find towns with no Park & Ride, such as Southampton, cause irritation to the lung,s.
It is irresponsible  not to provide the facilities for shopper & visitor traffic to park outside the city.
We cannot clean up air quality, if we just encourage more & more vehicle,s into Towns

attributes.action: Make landlords & agents give 24 hours notice to access shared rental housing.
attributes.background: I currently live in a share house where the agency accesses the home unannounced. Because my housemates and I complained, the agency tried to threaten me and we feel like we can't enjoy this new home because the laws regarding 24 hours notice to rentals don't include share houses, but they should.
attributes.additional_details: On citizensadvice.org.uk, it's states that landlords "...should always ask for your permission and should give you at least 24 hours notice." However, if you stay in lodgings where the landlord provides a room-cleaning service or where you share a room with other lodgers, your landlord can enter without permission. All my housemates and I have either had our items tampered with in communal areas or our rooms accessed without permission or without due notice. These exceptions should be illegal.

attributes.action: Make mansard and loft extensions permitted development in non-conservation areas
attributes.background: Mansard and loft extensions for terrace properties require planning permission.  This gives local authorities the power to refuse on design ground even when there is no objections from local residents.  These type of extensions should be automatically permitted except in conservation areas.

attributes.action: Investigate the link between 3G Football pitches and cancer.
attributes.background: 3G Football pitches are made from crumb rubber, pellets of which are often made from used car tyres, which contain toxic chemicals. It has been suggested that if these chemicals enter the body through, for example, cuts or scratches then they can contribute to Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35585392
http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10154596/report-claims-link-between-3g-pitches-and-cancer

attributes.action: When selecting route for HS3 include Manchester to carlisle.
attributes.background: HS2 is meant to provide a link from the North to the south. A full upgrade of the UK railway network is required to reach the actual North of England carlisle  in place of targeted more advanced areas where spending is already in place.

attributes.action: Make 16+ Zip Oyster cards a form of legal age identification for purchases.
attributes.background: Isn't it annoying going to the cinema and being turned away because you don't have any "accepted ID" on you? Trying to buy lottery tickets for your family? It isn't right that to be able to do these things, you have to carry your passport around, when there's a perfectly good ZIP card in your pocket

attributes.action: Do not ban fireworks to the public but increase the age of sale to 25 minimum.
attributes.background: Thousands of people respectively enjoy garden fireworks and use them accordingly, why should the whole nation have that taken away from them because of a few peoples irresponsible use of fireworks? It's not fair that everyone should pay because of a few.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks have been used since the 12th century, animals and people have coped fine, animal owners have information widely available to them to help their animals cope. Lifting the age of sale to 25 will help stop the irresponsible use of fireworks. It is simply not fair to spoil it for everyone because of a few!

attributes.action: Make the 6 week holidays shorter by spreading the weeks throughout the year.
attributes.background: The 6 week holidays are far too long and children get sluggish at the start of the new term. School grades and attitudes towards school should improve as more time learning.

attributes.action: Make it a legal obligation to have a mobile phone holder/mount fitted in cars.
attributes.background: It should be a legal obligation to have a phone dock, holder or mount fitted in your car to pass an MOT. It is illegal to have your phone in your hand while driving but for most, unfortunately it continues to be a problem. We hope to reduce the deaths associated with mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.additional_details: A recent video showed a lorry driver crashing into a line of cars, including one full of a family, because he was on his phone. He would not have taken his eyes off the road if he had had his mobile phone in a mount. It is devastating what has happened to this family, but for the driver as well. All he did was something that Everyone does at one time or another and he was unlucky. A family were killed instantly, this could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Stop the addictive drug Codeine being sold as an over the counter medicine.
attributes.background:
Many people are finding themselves taking Codeine on a regular basis through over the counter pain killers and cough medicine even when symptoms have stopped.
Codeine is an Opiate drug.
Despite fairly recent warnings on the packets and from sales assistants, people are becoming addicted.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on Codeine addiction and where to get help can be found online.
Many people are using these drugs to relax, get to sleep etc and becoming dependant.
This is a serious problem and health issue with a suprising amount of people finding themselves addicted and sales of these drugs are increasing.
Making these drugs prescription only and providing help for people who have become addicted would be a simple solution to the problem, manufacturers are the only ones benefitting from it.

attributes.action: change the law on websites listing companies without the owners permission
attributes.background: Parliament needs to change the law on how websites list companies without the company owners permission. It should be up to the business owner to decide where and how their business is displayed and advertised, and be removed from any website at the owners request.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for realistic road crash simulations of child car seats
attributes.background: Having done countless hours of research on car seats, I purchased a Nuna Rebl for my son based on positive reviews. However, it has now been listed as a dangerous car seat, yet meets the UN ECE R129 standards. Worryingly, these standards are extremely poor, and not representative of actual crashes.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently UN UCE R129 standards require seats to perform well in the following, totally unrealistic, crash simulations: 
Front impact: 31 mph
Rear impact: 18.6 mph
Side impact: 14.9 mph
These of course are not representative of many car accidents. If you hit another car head on, both driving at 20mph (a lower speed limit than in most residential areas), there will be a 40mph impact, which isn't covered by the existing required testing, putting children's lives at risk.

attributes.action: Mandatory Client Money Protection for Letting Agents
attributes.background: The Government is less than lukewarm about making it mandatory that all Landlord and Tenant money is safely held in Client Accounts and covered by insurance policies. Some of our present Landlords have lost thousands with agents that have closed down and run off with money they banked from Tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
A solicitor, conveyancer or even a financial adviser is not afforded the same trust. Unfortunately the small minority of agents do, often, run away with large sums of money!

Why are we as agents so poorly regulated?

Further discussion and details here: https://www.aaronjbarclay.co.uk/should-client-money-protection-be-mandatory. Estate agents in London and beyond should be made to comply.

Please sign if you feel this is a worthy petition.
